articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Site of Munsu Swimming Complex
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Site of Munsu Swimming Complex
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, inspected again the construction site of the Munsu Swimming Complex.
					 The soldier-builders are now waging a high-pitched drive day and night, pushing ahead with the project at the final phase in hearty response to the appeal of the supreme commander for successfully completing the construction by Oct. 10, the anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 He entered the lobby of the indoor swimming pool where a statue of leader Kim Jong Il will stand and praised painters of the Mansudae Art Studio for having drawn a panoramic picture of the sea shore in perspective.
					
					 At the indoor swimming pool with slides he said they look wonderful. It is good it admits sunrays, he added. He told the soldier-builders to paint the pillars of the slides with white color so that they may look fresh and nice.
					
					 He told officials to hang a large clock on the wall of the pool and set up sound equipment to add to its cheerful atmosphere. 
					
					 Going round the dressing room, he said it is necessary to provide it with mirrors and hairdryers, etc. in order to ensure best convenience to the visitors. He also underscored the need to make the floor inclined.
					
					 He told them to properly furnish the complex with furniture such as amusement tables in its different places including the balcony of the restaurant.
					
					 At the indoor sporting hall where sporting and amusement facilities are available he highly praised the soldier-builders for having successfully built the hall in a brief span of time in hearty response to the order of the supreme commander though it was not included in the original design, adding that it was very good to build the hall in the indoor swimming pool and the KPA carries out whatever task assigned to it.
					
					 He noted that if volleyball and basketball courts are built and a springboard is laid in the hall, youth and children will like them.
					
					 At the outdoor swimming pool he was satisfied to see the walls of the swimming pool being decorated with pictures of seagulls, dolphins, water drops, etc.
					
					 Going round different places of the outdoor swimming pool, he learned in detail about the assembling of various types of slides and the constructed wading pools and highly appreciated the success made in it.
					
					 He told officials to build a room for first aid treatment and an observation tower so that rescue measures may be taken. The swimming complex can be inaugurated only when all these conditions are provided, he added.
					
					 He underscored the importance of taking thorough measures for protecting the complex in winter.
					
					 It is good that the complex is being built in such a way as to ensure the supply of geotherm so that the complex may consume electricity as less as possible, he noted. 
					
					 He called for planting trees of good species and creating a larger area of lawn inside and around the complex.
					
					 Noting that the soldier-builders did a lot of work in just a few days, he said the completion of the complex would dramatically change the appearance of the area of Munsu. I am very pleased to picture it to myself, he added.
					
					 Saying that the dramatic change in the appearance of the area of Munsu is a miracle which can be worked only by the KPA possessed of the spirit of unconditionally carrying out any task under any circumstances, he once again highly praised the soldier-builders for their feats.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun, vice-department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Mirim Riding Club
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Mirim Riding Club
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the construction site of the Mirim Riding Club.
					 He went round the indoor riders training hall, service center for riders, outdoor spectators' seats, circular riding training ground, riding school, stables, etc. to learn about the progress made in the construction.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to learn that soldier-builders are pushing ahead with the construction of various buildings qualitatively at the final phase as required by the design of the club and methods of construction. 
					
					 He was pleased to see the soldier-builders pressing ahead with the construction of the horse-breeding institute and the epizootic hospital at a rapid speed as he instructed them while providing field guidance to the construction site in last August. 
					
					 Watching soldier-builders covering the outer wall of the building with timber, he underscored the importance of successfully applying antiseptic treatment to it so that the quality of timber is preserved and it is prevented from getting rotten. 
					
					 He learned in detail about the construction of the earth and sand track and lawn track of the club. 
					
					 Feasting his eyes with satisfaction on the hedge stretching along the earth and sand track, he said it looks nice. It is better to plant acacia along the line inside the track, he added.
					
					 After being told that the track has been built with famous Kaesong weathered gneiss mixed with salt in order to increase the capacity for preserving humidity and sterilization efficacy, he underlined the need to take thorough measures for providing the best convenience to the riders.
					
					 Watching the turf track, he said that Songchon golden turf of Korea is the best for riding track as it is strong in vitality and resistance to stamping. 
					
					 He learnt in detail about greening at the riding club. 
					
					 He mounted the manmade hill to command a bird's-eye view of the riding club. He stressed the need to plant fir trees which offer foliage in all seasons and maple trees along with flower shrubs. 
					
					 He said it is good to plant willow trees around the artificial pond which will have artificial falls and beach in order to add to the scenic beauty. 
					
					 He said that it is important to build a walking road for visitors' stroll on horse and cosy pavilions so that they may have good rest. 
					
					 It is necessary to steadily push ahead with the work for creating greenery after the construction of the riding club is over, he said. He stressed the need to make good preparations to operate the club as it is near completion. 
					
					 The anniversary of the WPK is near at hand, he said, expressing expectation and belief that the soldier-builders would unconditionally finish the construction of the riding club as scheduled as it is the WPK's gift to the people. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C, the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, and Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun, vice department directors of the C. C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolences to Mexican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Condolences to Mexican President
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a condolatory message to the president of United Mexican States on Sunday.
					 Kim in the message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the president and, through him, to the government, people and the bereaved families of Mexico as regards the hurricane that hit some areas of Mexico claiming great casualties and material losses.
					
					 He hoped that the president and government of Mexico would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster as early as possible and help the inhabitants in the disaster-battered areas return to a stable life.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Mexican FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Mexican FM
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK sent a message of sympathy to his Mexican counterpart on Sunday in connection with the strong hurricane which hit Mexico, claiming casualties and property losses.
					 Expressing deep sympathy to the victims and the bereaved families, the message expressed belief that the Mexican government and people would eradiate the aftermath of the natural disaster as soon as possible through their positive efforts.

articles.title: Greetings to Malian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malian President
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Ibrahim Boubacar Keita, president of the Republic of Mali, on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the proclamation of the republic.
					 The message expressed conviction that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in all fields of politics, economy and culture, sincerely wishing the president and people of Mali success in their work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Sunday, the 64th anniversary of her demise. 
					 Seen standing there was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA). 
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior officials of the party, state and army. 
					
					 Laid before her bust were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet. 
					
					 Also laid there were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, KPA units, scientific, educational and media institutions, joint national organizations of the Korean Children's Union, party and power bodies, factories and farms in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to her, recollecting her revolutionary life. 
					
					 Meanwhile, floral baskets were laid before her statues in Kim Jong Suk County, Hoeryong City, Kim Jong Suk Naval University and Kim Jong Suk General Military Academy on the same day. 
					
					 Floral tribute was paid to her statues in the name of local party and power organs, working people's organizations, units of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, industrial establishments, farms, schools, etc.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Sunday. 
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Rajin-Khasan Railway Section Opens for Service
articles.content:
Rajin-Khasan Railway Section Opens for Service
 Rason, September 22 (KCNA) -- Rajin-Khasan railway section has been successfully rebuilt and opened for service with due ceremony in Rajin on Sunday. 
					 The opening of the section will greatly contribute to developing the friendly and cooperative relations between Russia and the DPRK. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony from the DPRK side were Jon Kil Su, minister of Railways, O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Chol Sok, vice-chairman of the State Commission for Economic Development, Jo Jong Ho, chairman of the Rason City People's Committee, Im Chon Il, consul general of the DPRK to Nakhodka, officials in the field of railways and people in Rason City. 
					
					 Present there from the Russian side were V. I. Yakunin, president of the "Russian Railways" Company, Alexei Tsijenov, vice-minister of Transport, Sergey Sidorov, first vice-governor of the Maritime Territory Administration, Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Vyacheslav Tsupikov, consul general of Russia to Chongjin, and Russians including those concerned with the railways.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys to the DPRK also attended.
					
					 V. I. Yakunin in the opening ceremony said the section has opened for service under Russia-DPRK Moscow Declaration signed by the top leaders of the two countries in 2001.
					
					 To press for the renovation of the railways running through the land of Korea will be of great contribution to the development of economic cooperation in the Asia-Pacific region in the future, he stressed.
					
					 Minister of Railways of the DPRK in his speech said that the plan of linking DPRK-Russia railways serves as a model of wide-ranging bilateral cooperation which meets the common progress and interests of the two peoples.
					
					 He expressed the conviction that the operation of the opened railways section will be successful as it was made on the principle of mutual respect and cooperation between the railway transportation fields of the two countries.
					
					 There were congratulatory speeches.
					
					 The ceremony ended with the playing of national anthems of the two countries. It was followed by a reception.

articles.title: Japanese Government Urged to Make Official Apology for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japanese Government Urged to Make Official Apology for Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wednesday meeting took place in Paris demanding the settlement of the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to KBS of south Korea on Sept. 19.
					 It was attended by members of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea, victims of the sexual slavery, overseas Koreans and members of human rights and social organizations in France.
					
					 On display in the venue of the meeting were materials showing the crimes related to sexual slavery perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists in the past, crimes against humanity.
					
					 Its participants demanded the Japanese government make an official apology and honestly repent of the crimes.

articles.title: Those Who Hurt Dignity of DPRK's Supreme Leadership Will Pay Dearly: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Those Who Hurt Dignity of DPRK's Supreme Leadership Will Pay Dearly: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- These days the south Korean authorities let reptile media run the whole gamut of vituperation hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					 The south Korean conservative media including YTN, quoting a report of Asahi Shimbun of Japan on Saturday, spread rumor about "punishment" and "covering" in a bid to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 On the same day south Korean CBS aired a false story that the DPRK forced all people to write reflection letter pledging renewed loyalty to the leader and the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 On Thursday the conservative group slandered even the autograph of Marshal Kim Jong Un, a proof of his noble love for the people, as "the one to emphasize the meaning of the leader for people". 
					
					 This is an unpardonable hideous provocation hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and thrice-cursed crime which can be committed only by the confrontation maniacs. 
					
					 No matter how mad the puppet group goes with confrontation with compatriots, there is the red line of recklessness it should not cross.
					
					 The supreme leadership of the DPRK is ardently revered by all Koreans and enjoys deep respect from all peoples. How can the group dares slander its highest and greatest dignity with such sheer lies?
					
					 This is barbarism and thrice-cursed treason which can hardly be imagined by human beings.
					
					 The world knows no such hooligans as the puppet group going so reckless, feeling no fear of thunderbolt and groundlessly hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership.
					
					 The hideous provocation perpetrated by the group is nothing but death-bed frenzy of those taken aback by the dynamic advance of the service personnel and people of the DPRK ushering in a new era of prosperity, holding the peerlessly great man in high esteem. It is also the last-ditch effort to tarnish its image and break its single-minded unity.
					
					 As a crow's croak cannot but sound hoarse, only silly talks can be heard from the confrontation maniacs bent on hatching plots against the DPRK. No one would lend an ear to the outbursts of such psychopaths.
					
					 No matter how desperately the group may try to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, it will only more saliently reveal its true colors as dyed-in-the wool confrontation maniacs.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have faced again a grave situation because the group made its servants of conservative media let loose a whole string of sophism intended to hatch all sorts of dastardly wicked plots and float misinformation.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are now shaking with resentment and pledge to seek revenge upon the group of traitors who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership.
					
					 Nothing can prevent the sun of Songun from shedding its brilliant rays just as the sun cannot be covered up with a palm. 
					
					  The group is bound to meet the same miserable end as that of those who were thrown into a dumping ground of history for going reckless to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 All the service personnel and people of the DPRK will never pardon those who commit such a hideous crime but mete out a stern punishment to them as it has already declared.
					
					 They will have to pay a very high price for such thrice-cursed crime.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The working-level talks between authorities of the north and the south of Korea for the reunion of separated families and their relatives scheduled to be held on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day and the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang have been postponed indefinitely, as reported on Saturday. 
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in its information bulletin No. 1042 on Sunday said:
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is to wholly blame for this. It is a product of its vicious moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen as it malignantly slandered the broad-minded and sincere efforts of the DPRK to improve the inter-Korean relations and its will for dialogue and deliberately blocked the undertakings for achieving national reconciliation and improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 All Koreans are expressing surging resentment at the puppet regime which has driven the inter-Korean relations again into confrontation and tensions, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 Much upset by this, the puppet regime made a spokesman for the Ministry of Unification release a "statement to the north" in which he was so base as to evade the responsibility for it, letting loose a string of poor excuses that "it is regrettable" and "the south worked hard to bring the relations to normal by building confidence in the spirit of mutual recognition and peace".
					
					 Worse still, it termed the just steps and warnings of the DPRK "acts against humanity". It went the lengths of trumpeting about "decisive countermeasure" and "international sanctions and resolute retaliation", revealing again its true colors as confrontation maniacs.
					
					 This is a revelation of its treacherous scenario to evade its blame for the grave situation through its confrontation with the DPRK and mud-slinging, stoke hatred and antagonism towards the DPRK and stem the trend towards the improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is talking about "settlement of humanitarian issue" while taking issue with the DPRK but it is nothing but hypocrisy. The south Korean authorities have no face to talk about humanitarianism.
					
					 There were two rounds of reunion of separated families and their relatives at Mt. Kumgang resort in the period of the previous regime when the inter-Korean confrontation was at its height, thanks to the proposal and positive efforts of the north as is the case with the planned reunion. This is a well known fact. 
					
					 Feeling extremely uneasy about the desire for peaceful reunification growing strong in south Korea, the regime let conservative media and die-hard confrontation maniacs clamor about the fruition of "process for confidence-building on the Korean Peninsula" and "fruition of the theory of principle". It staged madcap war maneuvers targeted against the DPRK and made much ado about "pro-communist elements" and "forces following the north," going against the trend of improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is unpardonable violation and mockery of humanitarianism for the warmongers to talk about "human ethics", while going hysteric with fever of war against the DPRK after massively introducing war hardware into south Korea. 
					
					 The DPRK stands for the settlement of the inter-Korean relations and their improvement including humanitarian undertakings but will never remain a passive onlooker to the reckless acts to encroach upon its dignity and self-esteem even a bit and hurt it.
					
					 The prospect of the inter-Korean relations will entirely depend on the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Much Ado about "Enemy-Benefiting Organization" Dismissed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Much Ado about "Enemy-Benefiting Organization" Dismissed
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy of south Korea released a statement on September 17 denouncing the puppet regime for frantically suppressing a progressive pro-reunification organization.
					 The statement accused the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency of going mad with suppression of the "Wind of Youngsters Meeting for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration."
					
					 It said that the regime is trying to label the organization "an enemy-benefiting organization", claiming that its actions for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces, the repeal of the "Security Law" and the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are identical to assertions of the north.
					
					 It also slammed the regime for distributing false information among media, deliberately linking the organization with the Unified Progressive Party.
					
					 How many progressive organizations would not fall victim to the whirlwind of suppression kicked up by the security authorities to cook up "enemy-benefiting organizations," it queried, and went on:
					
					 The period of the "yusin" rule was the dark one when progressive forces were arrested one day and pro-reform forces were walked off the other day and it was followed by the arrest of religious forces.
					
					 All facts go to prove that the fascist dictatorship has been totally revived by the present regime.
					
					 It demanded the authorities stop the said campaign and halt at once the fascist hysteria.
					
					 The authorities will not be able to tide over the ruling crisis with the wind of "yusin" going against democracy, it said, adding: People's candlelight rallies demanding the disbandment of the Intelligence Service and the resignation of the present regime will put a definite end to the undemocratic regime.

articles.title: British Social Bodies Condemn S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces
articles.content:
British Social Bodies Condemn S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a joint statement on Sept. 10 in protest against the south Korean conservative group's suppression of the progressive democratic forces.
					 The statement said that the above-said organizations of Britain are watching the action taken by the south Korean authorities to arrest a lawmaker from the Unified Progressive Party on charge of "the attempted rebellion", adding it is a disgusting fascist "witch-hunt", a brutal suppression of the party and other democratic forces.
					
					 The case is a reckless campaign to block the reconciliation and detente between the north and the south, the statement said, and continued:
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is linking the recent case with the DPRK, escalating the tensions.
					
					 The regime is pursuing two aims: eradicating the progressive democratic forces and escalating the tensions and confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 We demand that the south Korean authorities drop the charges brought against the lawmaker and release all arrested pro-reunification patriots and progressive people.
					
					 We urge all progressive forces and trade unions of Britain to condemn such fascist suppression in south Korea.

articles.title: French Organization Posts Kim Jong Un's Talk on Its Website
articles.content:
French Organization Posts Kim Jong Un's Talk on Its Website
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Front of France posted on its website supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution."  The talk was published in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The talk, made public on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and clarifies the essence and originality of the idea of the Songun revolution and the tasks to be carried out to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Nepali Papers Observe DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Nepali Papers Observe DPRK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Nepali papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Ostito on September 6 carried an article titled "Founder of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea" illustrated with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung. It said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung paved the way of building a people's government for protecting and meeting the interests of the people from all walks of life including workers and peasants from an independent stand.
					
					 He thus founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East.
					
					 He beat back the aggression of the U.S. that boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, honorably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country and successfully steered the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction, while leading the DPRK for several decades.
					
					 Janmabhumi on Sept. 7 carried a photo of Kim Il Sung and an article titled "DPRK Today" saying the DPRK is regarding independence as the life and soul of the country and the nation.
					
					 The paper said that the DPRK is channeling great efforts into building a highly civilized socialist nation, adding that grand monumental edifices and cultural recreation grounds for the people are springing up in different parts of the country and that sports enthusiasm is running high in the country. 
					
					 Charcha on Sept. 2 carried a photo of Kim Il Sung and said in an article that the DPRK has covered the path of glory and is bringing about miracles and innovations in all fields of socialist construction at the "speed on Masik Pass."
					
					 The Jonaprakash on Sept. 9 allotted its one whole page to articles titled "The National Flag of the DPRK" and "The Story about the National Anthem."

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were held by the Maritime Territorial Branch of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea between September 1 and 4 on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK, September 9.
					 Speakers including the coordinator of the Maritime Territorial Branch of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia said that the DPRK is fully demonstrating its might as the socialist country of Juche.
					
					 They declared they would always support the principled stand of the party and government of the DPRK for defending peace and stability in the Asia-Pacific region and make positive efforts to develop the Russia-DPRK friendly relations.
					
					 They expressed conviction that the Korean people would register greater success in building a thriving socialist nation and carrying out the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said that the exploits Kim Il Sung performed in the nation-building and those Kim Jong Il did by leading the Songun revolution would last forever along with their august names.
					
					 The secretary general of the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that the DPRK, which is accelerating the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, would shed brilliant rays as an ideal society of humankind.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Broadcasting Services
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Broadcasting Services
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- TV and radio broadcasting services of various countries aired special programs between September 7 and 9 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Cuban television introduced the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in the nation-building and the feats leader Kim Jong Il did in the Songun revolution and the situation of the DPRK, which has turned into a highly civilized socialist country under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. It also showed celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War held with splendor in the presence of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Syrian Central TV showed a portrait of the smiling President and photos documenting immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The DPRK traversed the road of great victories and glory under the outstanding leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were the tender-hearted fathers who devoted their all to the happiness of the people till the last moments of their lives and the greatest men who made immortal contributions to the human cause of independence.
					
					 They are always alive in the hearts of the world progressives.
					
					 The future of the DPRK is rosier as it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK will fully demonstrate its invincible might as a true socialist country.
					
					 The central radio broadcasting service of Syria introduced the 65-year history of the DPRK.
					
					 The Teleambiente TV Consortium of Italy aired Korean films dealing with the undying exploits Kim Jong Il performed in the Songun revolution.
					
					 The domestic and international and seven national language channels of the radio broadcasting service of Guinea and the national broadcasting service of Equatorial Guinea aired programs dealing with facts that the DPRK has made efforts to build an economic power, a scientific and technological power and sports power, consolidating the status of the political and ideological power under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked at Its Diplomatic Missions Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked at Its Diplomatic Missions Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Receptions, book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place at DPRK's missions in Indonesia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Malaysia, Poland, Bulgaria, the Czech Republic, the UK, Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy, Ethiopia, Equatorial Guinea, Nigeria, Senegal and Peru, its permanent mission at the UN and its permanent missions at the UN Office and international organizations in Geneva from Sept. 4 to 9 on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were personages of foreign governments, political parties, military, social bodies, institutions, organizations for the study of the Juche idea, organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people, international and regional bodies, non-governmental organizations and diplomats of various countries.  Officials of the DPRK missions in those countries were present there.
					
					 The advisor of the Presidential Advisory Council of Indonesia said that while staying in the DPRK, he witnessed great successes made by the people of the DPRK in the building of an economic power under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The vice-minister of the Prime Minister's Office of Malaysia noted that the DPRK will become more prosperous as supreme leader Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to developing the economy and improving the people's living standard.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) stressed that the world progressives would invariably extend full support to the people of the DPRK in their struggle to reliably defend socialism under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in the nation-building would last forever.
					
					 The minister of state for Foreign Affairs of Nigeria said that the world people highly praise Kim Jong Un for leading the DPRK to victory and glory.
					
					 The chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru and the general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru noted that the DPRK, which was founded by Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il, will win victory after victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un."
